summary: The Pacific Ready Coast Guard Act mandates an annual plan and budget display for Coast Guard operations in the Pacific region, focusing on supporting Department of State and Department of Defense missions. It also requires reports on: establishing a standing Indo-Pacific maritime group; forward operating bases; Coast Guard attachés in Indo-Pacific embassies; and the feasibility of attaching Department of State consular officers to Coast Guard and Navy missions in Pacific Island countries. The bill aims to enhance U.S. presence and efficiency in the Indo-Pacific.
